pullRequest.body:
Define the expectation of a function `f : ι → M` over a finset `s : Finset ι` as `∑ i ∈ s, f i` divided by `s.card`.

Naïvely, this requires `M` to be a semifield but, since `s.card⁻¹` is rational, we can get away with assuming `M` to be a `NNRat`-module. This generality is important to talk about expectation of functions.

From LeanAPAP


---

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
This is [Finset.centerMass](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Convex/Combination.html#Finset.centerMass) with a constant weight of `1`, right?

Yes and no:
* Yes, there is a common generalisation of `Finset.centerMass` and `Finset.expect`
* No, this common generalisation is far away, because I have a huge refactor of convexity in the works and I can't ensure `Finset.centerMass` will stay the way it is
Unrequesting my review for this because I wrote early versions of this API
Should I take that as you bring happy with this version, @b-mehta? I agree that means you probably shouldn't merge, but an approval would be a valuable signal!

Build failed (retrying...):

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10904921761/job/30262525848)
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10908966569/job/30276134479)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
LGTM, but as mentioned above I'd like others to review and merge, not me.
I'm happy modulo changes mentioned above!
LGTM, but as mentioned above I'd like others to review and merge, not me.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

This is more `expectWith_congrFun`, not a fully general congruence, which could be
```lean
lemma expectWith_congr (p q : ι → Prop) [DecidablePred p] [DecidablePred q] (hst : s = t)
    (hpq : ∀ i ∈ s, p i ↔ q i) (h : ∀ i ∈ s, p i → f i = g i) :
    𝔼 i ∈ s with p i, f i = 𝔼 i ∈ t with q i, g i
```

```suggestion
  as `expectWith` in lemma names.
* `𝔼 (i ∈ s) (j ∈ t), f i j` is notation for `Finset.expect (s ×ˢ t) (fun ⟨i, j⟩ ↦ f i j)`.

## TODO

* Connect `Finset.expect` with the expectation over `s` in the probability theory sense.
-/
```
Can you dedup this with the `Finset.sum` printer somehow?

Sounds too fragile. I would need to keep the argument orders in sync (note that `expect` has a `Module _ _` argument which `sum` and `prod` don't have OR make the general delaborator parametric over the argument order, but I don't know how to make a parametric match
Let's use the notation here and below
Let's add expect_product too
Not sure the notation is worth it here
typo?
Don't you want AlgebraMap here?
By precedent in mathlib, no. But I agree it's a weird namespace to use
Weird, but okay!
Let's add a comment about the rewrite direction of these, like we have in the finset versions of similar lemmas

```suggestion
Connect `Finset.expect` with the expectation over `s` in the probability theory sense.
Give a formulation of Jensen's inequality and the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality in this language.
```

imo we should add an implementation note here explaining why this definition is helpful to have, as it isn't immediately clear otherwise. That is, why is this useful when probability expectation exists, and why is it not just an abbreviation on top of Finset.sum. Of course I'm fully on board with this definition being in mathlib, but to future readers / contributors these factors may not be clear.
I'm not sure I addressed exactly your point. Please comment if you want further modifications

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Expectation of a function over  a finset
